About Me

Hi I am Waleed Khamies , an applied scientist. and ML grad. I am passionate about learning semantic representations from multimodal data. Also, I am interested in mapping these inferred meanings to autonomous actionable insights.
Previously, I worked as research engineer intern at Mila under the supervision of Liam Paull, where my research focusing on developing deep learning models that suitable to robotics applications in noisy scenarios. I received my master at AMMI in Mathematical sciences/Machine learning, where I worked in interpretability of reinforcement learning under the supervision of George konidaris, previously I received my bachelor degree at UofK in Electrical and electronics engineering, where I worked under the supervision of Benjamin Rosman.
If you are interested in learning more about Machine Learning, Algorithms, or Data Science, check out my recent blog posts from here.
Interested in explore my Github repos? if you find something interesting, collaboration or have some notes that help me improve, please drop me a message, I would love to hear your opinion, and suggestions.
Also, if you feel lazy to scroll! you can find an organized portfolio to my work here.
Finally, If you are interested in getting exclusive contents and cheatsheets related to Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Data Science, join my newsletter from here.

Publications

  • Khamies, Konidaris; Interpretable Reinforcement Learning Using Latent Reward Functions; 2019; NeurIPS Workshop: BAI.
  • Khamies, Mohammedalamen, Rosman; Transfer learning For Prosthetic Using Imitation Learning; 2018; NeurIPS Workshop: BAI.
